availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Rader (Jackson County, Kentucky, farmer, soldier, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Jackson County, Kentucky, farmer, soldier, and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Rader. Father of Alfred Rader, John Rader, and Henry Rader. Resident of Jackson County in 1860. Corporal in the Sixth Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment from November 1861 to January 1864 and April 1864 to December 1864. Corporal in the Second Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment from January 1864 to April 1864. Justice of the peace in Jackson County in 1865.

bibl.p: Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0071; Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0021; Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport â€“ Microfilm (before 1911). Microfilm roll #7016201. Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky, Certificate# 33164 (accessed via Ancestry.com); Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jackson County, Sturgeon, p. 8; KYR-0001-007-0340.
